definition: social gathering at which those attending take it in turns to perform for the whole group (music, dancing or comedy etc)

sentences.english: The strong bond between Rachel and her fans can be felt from the interaction with her fans at the .
sentences.chinese: 和粉絲的交情從《粉絲同樂會》的互動中便能察覺。

sentences.english: Premier and Mrs. Yu had fun watching the monkeys on a trip to Leofoo Village Safari Park.
sentences.chinese: 賢伉儷於六福村野生動物園與人猿同樂。

sentences.english: Just keep in mind that the object of the game is to share sex between three people.
sentences.chinese: 遊戲的最終目的是三人同樂。

sentences.english: They should change this bad habit and condescend to be pleased what is pleasing.
sentences.chinese: 他們應該改變這種壞習慣，放下身段，與衆同樂。

sentences.english: At 4 , I have gone out with Lok and went to Muji bought some pen .
sentences.chinese: 在4條，我出去同樂玩，前往無印良品買了筆。

sentences.english: Rejoice in your friends, avoid the law and controversies.
sentences.chinese: 與人爲善，與友同樂，莫觸犯法律，涉及爭論。

sentences.english: Lion Dance, Cultural Performance, Acrobatic Performance and Lucky Draw.
sentences.chinese: 醒獅賀歲，精彩表演，新春抽獎，與衆同樂。

sentences.english: The only thing more fun than playing near the ocean is playing in the ocean.
sentences.chinese: 唯一比在海邊玩耍更有趣的事就是與海同樂。

sentences.english: In the hush of dark I share the cheerfulness of crickets and the confidence of owls.
sentences.chinese: 在夜色的沉寂中，蟋蟀們伴我同樂，夜梟也與我交心。

definition: to cooperate on a great undertaking or joint project
Lantern Festival, the final event of the Spring Festival 春節|春节, on 15th of first month of the lunar calendar
to celebrate a festival/after the celebrations (i.e. once the festival is over)
